page.title: 03Masson Mill - Matlock Bath
page.content: { {Masson Mill}is situated on the west bank of the R.Derwent between Matlock Bath and Cromford.The boiler house chimney is 175 feet high.Masson Mill was opened in 1771 by{Richard Ark- {wright}as a cotton mill.The mill's main function is that of doubling and twisting sewing thread.Threads of different thicknesses and strengths are produced for various purposes - from lingerie to carpets.The products are exported world-wide.The mill employs 110 people. The workers come from many surrounding villages and Matlock. The River Derwent water powered turbine produces about 10% of electricity needed, the remainder coming from the National Grid.The automatic machines run for 42 hours at a time,the thread being constantly inspected and rejoined when necessary.
